publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-3032# Irene Oldfather: Scotland and Europe Day-That the Parliament is proud to mark Europe Day as a celebration of the founding of the European Union (EU); endorses the fundamental principles of the EU as set out in the Declaration by Robert Schuman on 9 May 1950; welcomes the contribution that the EU has made towards peace and solidarity across Europe; notes the relevance of the EU to the working of the Scottish Parliament and to the everyday lives of Scots, and encourages the people of Scotland, young and old, to join with citizens across Europe, in the celebration of our common values and to participate in the debate on the future of Europe.
S1M-3032# Scotland and Europe Day (lodged on 24 April 2002) Trish Godman*

S1M-3032# Irene Oldfather: Scotland and Europe Day-That the Parliament is proud to mark Europe Day as a celebration of the founding of the European Union (EU); endorses the fundamental principles of the EU as set out in the Declaration by Robert Schuman on 9 May 1950; welcomes the contribution that the EU has made towards peace and solidarity across Europe; notes the relevance of the EU to the working of the Scottish Parliament and to the everyday lives of Scots, and encourages the people of Scotland, young and old, to join with citizens across Europe, in the celebration of our common values and to participate in the debate on the future of Europe. Supported by: Trish Godman, Robert Brown*, Sarah Boyack*
S1M-3032# Scotland and Europe Day (lodged on 24 April 2002) Helen Eadie*, Margaret Jamieson*, Mr Michael McMahon*, Colin Campbell*, Rhoda Grant*, Tavish Scott*, Susan Deacon*, Karen Gillon*

S1M-3032# Scotland and Europe Day (lodged on 24 April 2002) Jackie Baillie*, Mr Keith Raffan*, Janis Hughes*, Mr John McAllion*, Brian Fitzpatrick*, Karen Whitefield*, Mr John Home Robertson*, Mr Jamie Stone*
S1M-3032# Scotland and Europe Day (lodged on 24 April 2002) Fiona Hyslop*
S1M-3032# Scotland and Europe Day (lodged on 24 April 2002) Nora Radcliffe*, Donald Gorrie*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Maureen Macmillan*

S1M-3032# Irene Oldfather: Scotland and Europe Dayâ€”That the Parliament is proud to mark Europe Day as a celebration of the founding of the European Union (EU); endorses the fundamental principles of the EU as set out in the Declaration by Robert Schuman on 9 May 1950; welcomes the contribution that the EU has made towards peace and solidarity across Europe; notes the relevance of the EU to the working of the Scottish Parliament and to the everyday lives of Scots, and encourages the people of Scotland, young and old, to join with citizens across Europe, in the celebration of our common values and to participate in the debate on the future of Europe. Supported by: Trish Godman, Robert Brown, Sarah Boyack, Helen Eadie, Margaret Jamieson, Mr Michael McMahon, Colin Campbell, Rhoda Grant, Tavish Scott, Susan Deacon, Karen Gillon, Jackie Baillie, Mr Keith Raffan, Janis Hughes, Mr John McAllion, Brian Fitzpatrick, Karen Whitefield, Mr John Home Robertson, Mr Jamie Stone, Fiona Hyslop, Nora Radcliffe, Donald Gorrie, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Maureen Macmillan, Ian Jenkins*
S1M-3032# Scotland and Europe Day (lodged on 24 April 2002) Andrew Wilson*, Shona Robison*
